creator: mail@simon-tiffert.de
text:
The GET link for an undeployment of an app returns to the list view of all applications. After a server side deployment of the app I refreshed the page and wondered, where my application was gone. It was again undeployed, because the URL was still: http://XXX:8080/manager/html/undeploy?path=/app

If a POST call or a redirect after commit is used, this wouldn't be a problem.

GET vs. POST:
http://www.w3.org/2001/tag/doc/whenToUseGet.html#checklist

This isn't going to change for 6.0.x due to the risk of breaking existing automated set-ups.

It has already been fixed, along with a number of other improvements, for Tomcat 7.
